summary: This document is a transcript of court proceedings from an Epstein-related case. It shows the defense attorney moving for a mistrial due to issues with witness testimony regarding the use of first names to protect alleged victims' identities. The judge denies the motion and implements a procedure to provide witnesses with a list of individuals whose identities should be protected.

persons.name: Mr. Agnifilo
persons.context: Defense attorney who moves for a mistrial and objects to the judge's proposed jury instruction regarding the protection of alleged victims' names.

persons.name: Denise Parisi
persons.context: Court reporter credited at the bottom of the transcript pages.

connections.description: Attorney representing the defendant interacting with the judge regarding procedural matters and objections.

events.title: Motion for Mistrial Denied
events.description: The defense attorney moves for a mistrial due to issues with witness testimony about using first names to protect alleged victims' identities. The judge denies the motion.

events.title: Jury Instruction on Protected Identities
events.description: The judge provides a jury instruction explaining that alleged victims' full names are being withheld from the public and press, and that witnesses will use first names only or refer to a protected list.

keyFacts: The defense moved for a mistrial over procedural issues regarding the protection of alleged victims' identities during testimony.
The judge denied the mistrial motion, stating the issue could be cured with a jury instruction.
A procedure was established to provide witnesses with a list of individuals whose identities should be protected from public disclosure.
The transcript reveals ongoing efforts to balance trial transparency with the privacy protection of alleged victims.
